projects.title: FILTER COFFEE BEANS
projects.subtitle: COLOMBIA Finca La Esperanza
projects.description:
In the diverse department of Nariño, in the south west of Colombia, bordering Ecuador and the Pacific Ocean, there is a municipality named Consacá. In the vereda (or township) of La Aguada, Jesús Ignacio Paredes cultivates approximately one hectare made up of three separate plots named La Esperanza.

Jesús Ignacio's daily life looks a bit different as we can imagine. The farm where he cultivates coffee is within a 20 minute walking distance from the place he lives. So he walks to the three plots of land, where his parents taught him everything he needs to know to be a successful producer, where his beloved Castillo and Colombia varietals grow, protected with a shade from other trees like plantain and citrus fruit trees. The crops grow at 1900 m.a.s.l. and he makes sure they are cared for.
